entities.description: Criteria for assessing the usability of responses in the survey.
Various drug categories including (h) inhalants, (i) methamphetamine, (j) prescription pain relievers, (k) prescription tranquilizers, (l) prescription stimulants, and (m) prescription sedatives.
Lifetime use or nonuse must be determined for multiple drug types.
Follow-up questions for respondents who initially refused to answer 'yes' or 'no' to the gate questions.
Nicotine vaping which was not included in the usability criteria.
Pipe tobacco which was excluded despite one related question.
Use of specific prescription drugs within the past year.
Use or nonuse of all specific prescription drugs, regardless of whether usage can be determined.
Specific hallucinogens needing follow-up questions, such as LSD, PCP, and MDMA.

relationships.description: Links the survey to criteria used for assessing the usability of responses.
Describes the types of drugs considered in usability criteria.
Indicates that lifetime use or nonuse must be determined for specific drug categories.
Describes that follow-up probes were included for certain drug use responses.
Indicates that nicotine vaping was not included in the usability criteria.
Indicates that pipe tobacco was excluded from the usability criteria.
Use of specific prescription drugs in the past year considered in usability criteria.
Indicates necessity for data on use or nonuse of all specific prescription drugs.
Details hallucinogens that required follow-up questioning.
